newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Goldman Sachs to advise in Romania telecoms sale.
newsitem.headline: Goldman Sachs to advise in Romania telecoms sale.

text.p: Romania's Communications Ministry has signed a contract with investment bank Goldman Sachs to advise on the privatisation of state-run telephone operator Romtelecom RA, the ministry said on Wednesday.
Last month, Goldman Sachs won a tender called by the ministry to designate an adviser to help it choose a strategic investor in the telephone monopoly.
Under the arrangement, Goldman Sachs will manage the bid for Romtelecom's privatisation, which would be preceded by the transformation of Romtelecom into a state-owned joint-stock company next month.

In the initial stage, the ministry plans to sell a 30 percent stake in the telephone operator by mid-1998. The remaining 70 percent would be eventually offered through the Bucharest stock exchange and in over-the-counter-trading.
The ministry recently said it had evaluated Romtelecom's assets and the market it could offer at around $6 billion.
